# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Sure, Here is the Julia code snippet to do it:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM")
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a dataframe as input, adds a new column `ym` to it and populates that column with the year and month of the DateTimes in format "yyyymm". The `Dates.format` function is used to convert DateTime values into strings in the desired format.

You can use this function like:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 2)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

After calling `add_yearmonth`, the new DataFrame `df` would look like:
| dt          | ym   |
|-------------|------|
| 2021-01-01 | 202101 |
| 2022-02-02 | 202202 |
